title: Home Link Format Fix - RESOLVED
details:
ISSUE: Home link formatting in VaultIndexContentGenerator navigation - RESOLVED

PROBLEM:
Currently using Obsidian wikilink syntax: [[{rootIndex}|Home]]
Should use standard markdown link syntax: [Home]({rootIndex})

CONTEXT:
- GetRootIndexFilename returns relative path like "../../MBA" 
- This should be used in markdown link format: [Home](../../MBA)
- Path separators need to be forward slashes (/) for markdown links
- Currently using Windows path separators (\) which won't work properly

COMPLETED CHANGES:

1. ‚úÖ Updated CalculateRelativePath method:
   - Removed conversion to Windows path separators
   - Now returns paths with forward slashes for markdown compatibility
   - Updated path combination logic to use forward slashes

2. ‚úÖ Updated navigation link format in AddNavigationSection:
   - Changed from: [[{rootIndex}|Home]]
   - Changed to: [Home]({rootIndex})
   - Applied to both hierarchy level 1 and other levels

3. ‚úÖ Maintained other link formats:
   - Back links still use wikilink syntax: [[{backLinkTarget}|{backLinkText}]]
   - Dashboard and Classes Assignments still use wikilink syntax
   - Only Home link uses markdown format for relative path navigation

RESULT:
Home links now generate as: "üè† [Home](../../MBA)" where "../../MBA" is the relative path from current folder to the main index file, properly formatted for markdown links with forward slashes.

All tests pass and solution builds successfully.
